intro: Arracacia nudicaulis, commonly known as the naked-stemmed arracacha, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its hollow, ridged stems. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a mild, aromatic scent. Arracacia nudicaulis is valued for its edible roots, which are used in traditional cuisines and herbal remedies.
